Description: Wall sherd of North Ionian pottery bowl; unusually heavily worn; interior black with three added white-red-white bands; exterior: upper preserved frieze has floral and dotted decoration; central frieze of goats grazing to right and filling ornaments of dotted rosettes, swastikas, quatrefoils and strokes; lower frieze of lotus buds and flowers; friezes divided by painted bands with remains of added colour.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.215)
